string-array.name: nlwData
string-array.item: 140101~Canada~New Year\’s Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar
140217~Canada~Family Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_Day_(Canada)~A statutory holiday occurring on a Monday in February. Observed in Alberta, Ontario, PEI and Saskatchewan
140418~Canada~Good Friday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary
140421~Canada~Easter Monday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Second day of the octave of Easter Week. Observed in Quebec
140519~Canada~Victoria Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victoria_Day~Celebrated on the last Monday before May 25, in honour of Queen Victoria\'s birthday
140701~Canada~Canada Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canada_Day~National day of Canada, celebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of the British North America Act, 1867
140804~Canada~Civic Holiday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civic_Holiday~A public holiday celebrated in most of Canada on the first Monday in August
140901~Canada~Labour Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Day~Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers

141013~Canada~Thanksgiving~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanksgiving_(Canada)~Occurring on the second Monday in October, is an annual Canadian holiday which celebrates the harvest and other blessings of the past year.

141111~Canada~Remembrance Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remembrance_Day~A memorial day observed in Commonwealth countries since the end of World War I to remember the members of their armed forces who have died in the line of duty
141225~Canada~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
141226~Canada~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day.Observed in Ontario
140101~USA~New Year\’s Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar

140120~USA~Birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr.~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Luther_King,_Jr._Day~Observed on the third Monday of January each year, which is around the time of King\'s birthday, January 15

140217~USA~Washington\’s Birthday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington\'s_Birthday~Celebrated on the third Monday of February in honor of George Washington, the first President of the United States
140526~USA~Memorial Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Memorial_Day~A day of remembering the men and women who died while serving in the United States Armed Forces

140704~USA~Independence Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Independence_Day_(United_States)~Commemorating the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776, declaring independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain
140901~USA~Labor Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labor_Day~A celebration of the American labor movement and is dedicated to the social and economic achievements of workers
141013~USA~Columbus Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Columbus_Day~The anniversary of Christopher Columbus\' arrival in the Americas, which happened on October 12, 1492
141111~USA~Veterans Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veterans_Day~Honors people who have served in the U.S. Armed Forces, also known as veterans
141127~USA~Thanksgiving Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanksgiving~A day of giving thanks for the blessing of the harvest and of the preceding year
141225~USA~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
140101~Australia~New Year\’s Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar

140127~Australia~Australia Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Australia_Day~The official national day of Australia, celebrated annually on 26 January, which marks the anniversary of the 1788 arrival of the First Fleet of British Ships at Sydney Cove, New South Wales, and raising of the Flag of Great Britain at that site by Governor Arthur Phillip

140310~Australia~Canberra Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canberra_Day~A public holiday held annually on the second Monday in March in the Australian Capital Territory (ACT) to celebrate the official naming of Canberra. Observed in Australian Capital Territory.
140418~Australia~Good Friday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary

140419~Australia~Easter Saturday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Saturday~Easter Saturday, or Bright Saturday, on the Christian calendar is the Saturday following the festival of Easter, the Saturday of Easter or Bright Week.

140421~Australia~Easter Monday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.

140425~Australia~ANZAC Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anzac_Day~a national day of remembrance in Australia and New Zealand that broadly commemorates all Australians and New Zealanders "who served and died in all wars, conflicts, and peacekeeping operations" and "the contribution and suffering of all those who have served."

140609~Australia~Queens Birthday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen\'s_Official_Birthday~The selected day on which the birthday of the monarch of the Commonwealth realms (currently Queen Elizabeth II) is officially celebrated

141006~Australia~Labour Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labour_Day~Annual holiday to celebrate the achievements of workers. Observed in Australian Capital Territory, New South Wales and South Australia.
141225~Australia~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
141226~Australia~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day
140101~UK~New Year\’s Day~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Year\'s_Day~The first day of the year on the modern Gregorian calendar
140418~UK~Good Friday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good_Friday~Commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary

140421~UK~Easter Monday~https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Easter_Monday~Easter Monday in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar is the second day of the octave of Easter Week and analogously in the Eastern Orthodox Church is the second day of Bright Week.Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.
140505~UK~May Day Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/May_Day~A traditional spring holiday and coincides with International Workers\' Day
140526~UK~Spring Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~Last Monday in May
140804~UK~Summer Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~First Monday in August. Observed in Scotland.
140825~UK~Summer Bank Holiday~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bank_holiday~Last Monday in August. Observed in England, Northern Ireland and Wales.
141031~UK~Halloween~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halloween~A yearly celebration on 31 October, the eve of the Western Christian feast of All Hallows\' Day

141105~UK~Guy Fawkes Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Fawkes_Night~Guy Fawkes Day, also known as Guy Fawkes Night, Bonfire Night and Firework Night, is an annual commemoration observed on 5 November
141225~UK~Christmas Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christmas~Annual commemoration of the birth of Jesus Christ
141226~UK~Boxing Day~http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boxing_Day~The first or second weekday after Christmas Day
